bug.author: ryangrimm
bug.summary: Updated version of plac breaks spacy.en.download.
bug.description:
Looks like python plac has been updated and is breaking the model download. Inside the spaCy requirements.txt file a version for plac hasn't been specified and it appears like the latest version of plac isn't backwards compatible (I haven't dug into this at all). However, with a fresh install of spaCy (which succeeded) and then downloading the model via python -m spacy.en.download, the following error results: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 162, in _run_module_as_main "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code exec code in run_globals File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/spacy/en/download.py", line 7, in <module> import plac File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/plac.py", line 38, in <module> from plac_tk import TkMonitor File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/plac_tk.py", line 46 print('Process %d killed by CTRL-C' % os.getpid(), file=sys.stderr) ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax </denchmark-code>
However, this problem can be worked around if I specify plac==-0.9.1 in my own requirements.txt file. <denchmark-code>plac==0.9.1 spacy==0.101.0 </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: I investigated a bit. Until <denchmark-link:https://github.com/micheles/plac/issues/17>micheles/plac#17</denchmark-link> is fixed I think spaCy should require (eg 0.9.2) to avoid the last version which has a universal wheel that only works on Python 3.
